title: The Story of My Life; Recollections and Reflections
author: Terry, Ellen
snippet: Our summer holidays, as I have said, were spent at Ryde. We stayed atRose Cottage (for which I sought in vain when I revisited the place theother day), and the change was pleasant, even though we were workinghard. One of the pieces father gave at the theater to amuse the summervisitors was a farce called "To Parents and Guardians."

title: The Story of My Life; Recollections and Reflections
author: Terry, Ellen

title: Sunny memories of foreign lands /
author: Stowe, Harriet Beecher
snippet: DEAR SISTER:At the station house in London, we found Rev. Messrs.Binney and Sherman waiting for us with carriages. C.went with Mr. Sherman, and Mr. S. and I soon found ourselves in a charming retreat called Rose Cottage, in Walworth, about which I will tell you more anon. Mrs. B.received us with every attention which the most thoughtfulhospitality could suggest.

title: Sunny memories of foreign lands.
author: Stowe, Harriet Beecher

Mrs. B. received us with every attention which the most thoughtful hospitality could suggest.
